dublin_core.dcvalue: Dr. Alain B. Labrique, Director, Johns Hopkins Global mHealth Initiative; Email: alabriqu@gmail.com

mCARE is an integrated mobile-phone and server-based software system that helps community health workers (CHWs) digitally manage their daily workflow, including systematic pregnancy surveillance, identification and registration of pregnant women, referral and emergency support, and timely and comprehensive essential newborn care.
Made available in DSpace on 2020-10-14T10:19:16Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 mcare_enhancing_neonatal_survival_in_rural_south_asia.pdf: 214260 bytes, checksum: cbe8638328937424a5fac56c5551ef8b (MD5)
mCare: Enhancing Neonatal Survival in Rural South Asia
Client education and behavior change communication, Data collection and reporting, Electronic health records, Provider work planning and scheduling, Maternal health, Newborn health
